body_html:
@ruanjiandong Many thanks for the reply!

If I follow your instructions, can I use the patch file I download from here, which fixes this issue: http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/bz/show_bug.cgi?id=1526

Or do I need to re-write that patch file to a different format which Bazel will understand?

EDIT: Looks like that patch file doesn't work out of the box. You definitely need to edit it to make it compatible with the way that Bazel calls it, which is patch -p1 -d . -i patch_file

If you could please provide some guidance on how to fix the patch file so that Bazel can use it correctly, I would greatly appreciate it.

Or do I need to re-write that patch file to a different format which Bazel will understand?
EDIT: Looks like that patch file doesn't work out of the box. You definitely need to edit it to make it compatible with the way that Bazel calls it, which is patch -p1 -d . -i patch_file
If you could please provide some guidance on how to fix the patch file so that Bazel can use it correctly, I would greatly appreciate it.
body:
@ruanjiandong Many thanks for the reply!

If I follow your instructions, can I use the patch file I download from here, which fixes this issue: http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/bz/show_bug.cgi?id=1526

Or do I need to re-write that patch file to a different format which Bazel will understand?

EDIT: Looks like that patch file doesn't work out of the box. You definitely need to edit it to make it compatible with the way that Bazel calls it, which is patch -p1 -d . -i patch_file

If you could please provide some guidance on how to fix the patch file so that Bazel can use it correctly, I would greatly appreciate it.
